qas.question: What does a typical pommel horse exercise consist of?

answers.text: both single leg and double leg work

qas.question: Single leg skills are found in the form of what normally?

answers.text: form of scissors, an element often done on the pommels

qas.question: What is the main staple of this event?

answers.text: when the gymnast performs a dismount

qas.question: What are two ways that a gymnist dismounts?

answers.text: by swinging his body over the horse, or landing after a handstand

qas.question: What exercise involves single arm and double arm work?
What is it called when a gymnast cartwheels on a pommel horse?

plausible_answers.text: when the gymnast performs a dismount
To make the exercise more challenging

context: <b5_0>A typical pommel horse exercise<b5_0/> involves <a0_0>both single leg and double leg work<a0_0/>. Single leg skills are generally found in the <a1_0>form of <b6_0>scissors<b6_0/>, an element often done on the pommels<a1_0/>. <a2_0>Double leg work<a2_0/> however, is the main staple of this event. The gymnast swings both legs in a circular motion (clockwise or counterclockwise depending on preference) and performs such skills on all parts of the apparatus. <b8_0>To make the exercise more challenging<b8_0/>, gymnasts will often include variations on a typical circling skill by turning (moores and spindles) or by straddling their legs (Flares). Routines end <a3_0><b7_0>when the gymnast performs a dismount<b7_0/><a3_0/>, either <a4_0>by swinging his body over the horse, or landing after a handstand<a4_0/>. This requires back muscles to do any sort of skill. From handstands being easy to back or front flips being a little difficult.
